verses.verse: And Moses<WH4872> spake<WH1696> unto the heads<WH7218> of the tribes<WH4294> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, This is the thing<WH1697> which Jehovah<WH3068> hath commanded<WH6680>.

When a man<WH376> voweth<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, or sweareth<WH7650> an oath<WH7621> to bind<WH631> his soul<WH5315> with a bond<WH632>, he shall not break<WH2490> his word<WH1697>; he shall do<WH6213> according to all that proceedeth<WH3318> out of his mouth<WH6310>.
Also when a woman<WH802> voweth<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, and bindeth<WH631> herself by a bond<WH632>, being in her father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>, in her youth<WH5271>,

and her father<WH1> heareth<WH8085> her vow<WH5088>, and her bond<WH632> wherewith she hath bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>, and her father<WH1> holdeth his peace<WH2790> at her<WH5088>; then all her vows shall stand<WH6965>, and every bond<WH632> wherewith she hath bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315> shall stand<WH6965>.

But if her father<WH1> disallow<WH5106> her in the day<WH3117> that he heareth<WH8085>, none of her vows<WH5088>, or of her bonds<WH632> wherewith she hath bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>, shall stand<WH6965>: and Jehovah<WH3068> will forgive<WH5545> her<WH1>, because her father disallowed her<WH5106>.
And if she be married to a husband<WH376>, while her vows<WH5088> are upon her<WH4008>, or the rash utterance of her lips<WH8193>, wherewith she hath bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>,

and her husband<WH376> hear<WH8085> it<WH2790>, and hold his peace at her in the day<WH3117> that he heareth<WH8085> it<WH5088>; then her vows shall stand<WH6965>, and her bonds<WH632> wherewith she hath bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315> shall stand<WH6965>.

But if her husband<WH376> disallow<WH5106> her in the day<WH3117> that he heareth<WH8085> it<WH4008>, then he shall make void her vow which is upon her, and the rash utterance of her lips<WH8193>, wherewith she hath bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>: and Jehovah<WH3068> will forgive her<WH5545>.
But the vow<WH5088> of a widow<WH490>, or of her that is divorced<WH1644>, even everything wherewith she hath bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>, shall stand against her<WH6965>.
And if she vowed<WH5087> in her husband<WH376>'s house<WH1004>, or bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315> by a bond<WH632> with an oath<WH7621>,

and her husband<WH376> heard<WH8085> it<WH2790>, and held his peace at her<WH5106>, and disallowed her not<WH5088>; then all her vows shall stand<WH6965>, and every bond<WH632> wherewith she bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315> shall stand<WH6965>.

But if her husband<WH376> made<WH6565> them null and void<WH6565> in the day<WH3117> that he heard<WH8085> them<WH4161>, then whatsoever proceeded out of her lips<WH8193> concerning her vows<WH5088>, or concerning the bond<WH632> of her soul<WH5315>, shall not stand<WH6965>: her husband<WH376> hath made them void<WH6565>; and Jehovah<WH3068> will forgive her<WH5545>.
Every vow<WH5088>, and every binding<WH632> oath<WH7621> to afflict<WH6031> the soul<WH5315>, her husband<WH376> may establish<WH6965> it<WH376>, or her husband may make it void<WH6565>.

But if her husband<WH376> altogether<WH2790> hold his peace<WH2790> at her from day<WH3117> to day<WH3117>, then he establisheth<WH6965> all her vows<WH5088>, or all her bonds<WH632>, which are upon her<WH6965>: he hath established them<WH2790>, because he held his peace at her in the day<WH3117> that he heard them<WH8085>.
But if he shall make<WH6565> them null and void<WH6565> after<WH310> that he hath heard<WH8085> them<WH5375>, then he shall bear her iniquity<WH5771>.

These are the statutes<WH2706>, which Jehovah<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> Moses<WH4872>, between a man<WH376> and his wife<WH802>, between a father<WH1> and his daughter<WH1323>, being in her youth<WH5271>, in her father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>.
